subject: RE: [junit] VisualAge JUnit
msgSnippet: The tools in VAJ can be somewhat tricky.  Basically, there are two ways to accomplish running anything from tools. 1. export .class files out to directory
messageBody:
The tools in VAJ can be somewhat tricky. Basically, there are two ways to
accomplish running anything from tools.

1. export .class files out to directory where the default.ini is, have the
default.ini refer to them as normal
2. don't export .class files out to directory where the default.ini is, have
the default.ini refer to them as normal

Simple? If you do #2, which I recommend, the added step is to put any
project you need in the workspace classpath (by default, we put every
project in there - but that's overkill). You also need to make sure that
you have the referenced project that you want to access in your workspace (I
know that sounds obvious, but just in case...). In addition it is good to
have the VAJ Tools API projects in your workspace (and include them in the
workspace classpath).

How is your default.ini file constructed?

-Jason
